3.subquestion: What is the difference between butter and margarine?

subanswer.text: The main differences between butter and margarine include their primary base ingredients, production methods, nutritional profiles, and uses. Butter is made primarily from cream, while margarine is made from vegetable oil. Margarine may also contain water, salt, emulsifiers, and other additives. Nutritional-wise, butter contains saturated fats, whereas margarine generally has less saturated fat but higher trans fats depending on the formulation.
